The Java Barrel Recipe is GARBAGE!!!

This was so much better with the Bedrock recipe using sticks, due to extra slabs being left over when building a composter. Sticks are commonly used to make tools, and by using the barrel recipe on Java, this separates it by use of one piece of wood from a chest. Sticks can be created from bamboo, which is why this recipe was so handy before bamboo got it's own block and can easily be created earlier in game. I was very disappointed when I had been playing hard mode and had been unaware of this recent change, resulting in me using my remaining wood to create additional sticks, which had used the remainder of my available wood at night time. PLEASE REVERSE PARITY.

+1 vote. I've never had lag on U.S. servers until Microsoft bought the game. It really is a burden to gameplay, player movement is choppy and PvP is impossible. The gap between high/low ping players is massive and it kills your ability to progress or climb the leaderboard because they're all dominated by low ping players. We need Transfer Packets.
We ABSOLUTELY NEED THIS to get lesser ping in PvP servers. I hope they also implement it in 1.8

This is a terribly needed packet. A lot of servers require dozen of dummy proxies for the sole purpose of getting server switching, increasing hosting cost, latency, and complexity. Mojang is just as aware of this as we are, since they implemented it for Bedrock.

Transfer packets are really needed. High ping destroys the game and makes it nearly unplayable. High ping players face A LOT of problems on PVP servers hosted in the US, especially if you are Asian or Australian. Bedrock has it, so why should Java not.
Adding the /fillbiome command cuts the need of third-party world editors to change biomes in the world on Bedrock.
The limit volume of the source region is not controlled by commandModificationBlockLimitgamerule as the gamerule does not exist in Bedrock. Instead it uses a hardcoded value 32768.

Example of the command:

Because biomes in a world are stored in cells of 4Ã—4Ã—4 blocks, this command is applied on each selected cell instead of each block.

Although biomes are stored in cells, biome boundaries are slightly fiddled with to make them smooth. So the shape of the region whose biome is actually changed is irregular.

The command only changes the biome, but not the blocks in it. For example, changing a forest to a desert with this command does not change the grass blocks to sand and does not plant cacti, but rabbit spawn in the new "desert" that still looks like a forest.

  • This command is used to attempt to change the biome between the two stone blocks to desert.
     
  • As shown here, the biome changes are not applied at the exact coordinates specified.
With that command, I turned a Plains Biome into a Swamp on Java. Wish I could use it on Bedrock.
Java had Fillbiome for over a year already. I thought mojang was focused on adding parody...
Because this has everything
I would love this and it would also be cool if we could play the old console edition on switch and bedrock with an â€œeditionsâ€ tab too. Great suggestion it should really be added +1!
The legacy world types are pointless. If you really want an artificially small world, just use the world border command.
the other guy who said use the world border. I'm talking to you. first world border is ugly second what if ur bedrock player?

It isnâ€™t that simple. World sizes on Console Edition do more than the /worldborder command on Java Edition can do. It affects the dimension scaling between the Overworld and the Nether. On Classic and Small it is 1:3, on Medium it is 1:6 and on Large it is 1:8 like Java. In addition to that the biomes are smaller on Console Edition and more common. This also applies to structures. Some structures are even more common on the Classic world size. In addition to that the nether doesnâ€™t have the same size as the overworld on Console Edition because it adjusts to the dimension scaling. At smaller sizes like Classic and Small it is 1:3 instead of 1:8 because otherwise the nether would be even smaller... too small. This is not how the /worldborder command works on Java Edition. All dimensions always have the same size.

to the guy who said "use world border" you do realise that on the old console editions the world size accounted for biomes too. doing that would give you like 3 giant biomes and the world border is super ugly.
I agree! Even if it has more limited functionality than the java one.
This sounds good in theory, but in practice it disrupts the consistent rhythmic nature of placing blocks. You end up placing more than you'd expect, since all items have a placing rhythm.
maybe speed it up a bit.

This is a great idea, please vote for this. I have Minecraft on a Nintendo switch for some time now and have not been able to transfer my worlds from there to other bedrock devices like the PC. This will make the game more open to more users and not just ones with Realms.

Itâ€™s even worse if you cannot use Realms Plus and your Switch fails completely before both Realms Plus and Nintendo Switch Online can both be obtained, along with linking a Microsoft Account.
this would be really helpful as i have many nostalgic, old creative worlds that i'd love to see with better framerate and render distance, as well as playing them on a much faster device.

It would also be nice if the Switch could directly have worlds from the Wii U edition transferred to it that can then be transferred elsewhere, because currently the only way of porting Wii U worlds to Bedrock is through the Legacy Console Edition, which never released physically on the Switch, and I think was available for barely a year, meaning most people simply don't have it.

Currently running into this issue as I'm attempting to play on a world of mine with a friend on PC, where I made the world on Switch and have previously been able to access them thanks to syncing together with the Microsoft account they're both under. However, as of update 1.21, apparently that no longer exists, so all the worlds and Realms I was able to play on either Switch or PC are now only on my Switch, and the ridiculous cost of a Realms subscription is an unfair paywall to play a game that has always been about hanging with friends. Yet another reason I hate Microsoft (Mojang is pretty good, it's Microsoft's business decisions I have beef with).

Please fix this garbage, Microsoft.

I want to be able to pickup my solo map and move it back and forth so I can play on my pc and then on the go. Realms are too laggy and you guys won't put the effort into fixing that and you're asking us to pay for that just to utilize our saves on multiple devices. Let's get real here.
